moves.1. d4: The Queen's Gambit Declined Marshall Defense Variant. But Black is giving up the center very early.
moves.1... d5 2. c4 Nf6 3. cxd5 Qxd5 4. Nc3 Qd: White has clear advantages in the center.
moves.7... Nb4 8. Bd2 a6 9. a3 Ng4 10. h3: Both black knights hang. Black's position will collapse.
moves.10... Nh6 11. axb4 Qxb4 12. Nxe5 Qxb2: The Queen is trapped, because b5 is no longer covered by Black (Rxa8).
moves.13. Bb5+ Kd8: Without central pawns and Queen, the uncastled King is open for attacks.
moves.14. Nd3 Ba3 15. Nxb2 Bxb2 16. Ra2 f5: ?? After the Queen's loss Black makes a severe failure.
moves.17. Bg5+: A Bishop's cross mate, rather seldom to observe.
